thread.title: Ground News - Dangerous waves hit California coastline
thread.title_full: Ground News - Dangerous waves hit California coastline

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Dangerous waves hit California coastline
text:
Summary by Ground News Large waves and high surf are expected to pound much of the Southern California coastline Thursday and into the weekend. Forecasters warn the conditions could be dangerous and raise the risk of flooding. A high surf advisory and coastal flood advisory will be in effect until 10 p.m. Saturday for all Los Angeles County beaches. Share menu More
Filters 15 Articles 15 Articles All Left Center Right
BBC News Center High Factuality Government: Government of the United Kingdom Dangerous high surf pummels California coast Officials warn residents to stay out of the water, but the big waves are attracting some daring surfers.

7 hours ago · Los Angeles, United States Read Full Article Gold Coast Bulletin Media Conglomerate: Murdoch Family High Surf and Flooding Threaten California Coastline Coastal flooding affected parts of Santa Cruz County on Thursday, December 28, as officials warned residents to avoid areas in Rio del Mar. Video shows conditions at the Rio del Mar Esplanade on Thursday morning. A coastal flood advisory and a high surf warning were in effect into Friday, per the NWS. Dangerously large breaking waves up to 40 ft were possible at certain locations on the California coast, the weather service said. Credit: Santa C…

16 hours ago · Southport, Australia Read Full Article The Mercury Media Conglomerate: Murdoch Family Large Waves Prompt Warnings Along North California Coast Coastal flood warnings were in place in Northern California on December 28 due to dangerously large breaking waves on December 28, weather officials said. This footage from CAL FIRE San Mateo shows big, foamy swells at Pescadero State Beach, about 35 miles south of San Francisco. The power of the waves and the risk of flooding presented an “immediate threat to life and property,” the National Weather Service said. Credit: CAL FIRE San Mateo via …
